repnme.cdata!:
Guinea - Education For All-Fast Track
            Initiative Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Education for All-Fast
            Track Initiative Project for Guinea were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and the Grantee performance was
            also moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            the bank’s swift engagement following periods of crisis can
            be instrumental in ensuring that Governments have the
            necessary financial and technical support to continue to
            implement their sector strategies and to provide services at
            a time when its own resources and capacity are more limited.
            Building on the strengths of complementary projects and
            helps to avoid duplication, cumulatively reinforce
            institutional capacity, and strengthen national capacity.
            The FC-PSE design and implementation was able to benefit
            from the ongoing IDA-funded Project. In addition to ensuring
            complementary in activities, it laid the foundation for
            strong cooperation and coordination within the sector and a
            good working relationship with the Government. As a result
            of the Bank’s long-standing support to Guinea, the FC-PSE
            was able to re-engage in the sector and begin implementation
            shortly after the Bank’s formal reengagement. The
            establishment of a robust M&E system is instrumental in
            ensuring that the outputs and outcomes of an operation are
            properly documented. Though the M&E system established
            and used in the context of the Project required input from
            various decentralized levels, the information provided by
            this system was critical for undertaking joint annual sector
            reviews and for adequately documenting and reporting on
            achievements observed under this operation.

repnme.cdata!:
Guinea - Education for All Fast Track
            Initiative Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Education for All
            Fast Track Initiative Project (EFA-FTI) Catalytic Fund (CF)
            for Guinea is to enhance equitable access to and quality of
            education in basic education while also strengthening
            decentralized management of the education system. The
            purpose of this restructuring is to: (i) allow the
            government of Guinea to narrow the scope of its education
            sector activities following the German Development Bank
            (Kreditanstalt  fur Wiederaufbau)  (KfW) decision to exit
            the pooled fund (KfW funds remain frozen since they are tied
            to the holding of parliamentary elections) and thus to
            reduce the scope of activities and amend the targets of
            results framework); (ii) provide the government team with a
            realistic timeline to implement the project; and (iii)
            achieve the Project Development Objectives (PDO). This
            projects includes three components those are followed; i)
            improving equitable access to basic education; ii) improving
            quality of basic education; iii) strengthening management of
            the education sector.
